```{r setup}
qc.classes <- c("instrument_QC", "prep_QC")
compound.file <- "../project-files/compound_intensities_norm_SERFF.txt"
compound.info.file <- "../project-files/compound_info.txt"
sample.info.file <- "../project-files/sample_info.txt"
out.file <- "../output-files/compound_intensities_assoc.txt"
intensities <- read.delim(compound.file, stringsAsFactors = F)
sample.info <- read.delim(sample.info.file)
#Exclude QC samples from this analysis
sample.info <- sample.info[!(sample.info$class %in% qc.classes),]   
ordered.intensities <- merge(sample.info[,c("sample_id", "injection_order")], intensities)
#Order by injection order - then the order of the samples will be the same as in sample.info
ordered.intensities <- ordered.intensities[order(ordered.intensities$injection_order),]

library(tidyr)
library(dplyr)
library(ggplot2)
```

## Log2 transformation

Visually checek the transformation

```{r log2}
log2.tf.frame <- as.data.frame(apply(ordered.intensities[,-c(1,2)], 2, log2 ))
log2.tf.frame$sample_id <- ordered.intensities$sample_id
dim(log2.tf.frame)

#Get frame to plot the distribution
wide.frame <- log2.tf.frame
keycol <- "compound_id"
valuecol <- "log2_intensity"
gathercols <- names(wide.frame)[grep("^C", names(wide.frame))]
long.frame <- gather_(wide.frame, keycol, valuecol, gathercols)

#Plot the log2 distribution of each compound
n <- nrow(log2.tf.frame)
m <- nrow(long.frame)
compound.window <- n*50 #Plot 50 compounds at a time
print(ggplot(long.frame[1:compound.window,], aes(x = compound_id, y = log2_intensity)) + geom_boxplot() + theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 90)))
for (i in 1:(floor(m/compound.window)-1)) {
  print(ggplot(long.frame[(i*compound.window+1):((i+1)*compound.window),], aes(x = compound_id, y = log2_intensity)) + geom_boxplot() + theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 90)))
}
print(ggplot(long.frame[(floor(m/compound.window)*compound.window+1):(dim(long.frame)[1]),], aes(x = compound_id, y = log2_intensity)) + geom_boxplot() + theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 90)))
```

## Histograms

Plot the histograms of couple of compounds

```{r histograms}
hist(long.frame$log2_intensity[long.frame$compound_id == "C32"], xlab="C32", main="")
hist(long.frame$log2_intensity[long.frame$compound_id == "C36"], xlab="C36", main="")
```

## Write output file for association testing

```{r write_output}
last.col <- dim(log2.tf.frame)[2]
out.frame <- log2.tf.frame[,c(last.col, 1:(last.col-1))]
write.table(out.frame, out.file,  sep="\t", quote=F, row.names=F, col.names=T)
```
